decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): SV(0)102 (block plan & site access plan); PA/202 Rev B (proposed basement plan floor plan); PA/203 Rev B (proposed ground floor plan); PA/205 Rev B (proposed site plan); PA/208 Rev B (proposed rear elevation); PA/209 Rev C (proposed detailed section A-A); Daylight Factor, ref: Z34933A; Environmental Noise Report ref:Z34933
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match those of the existing building unless indicated on the approved plans or application form. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), London Plan(2021) policies D3, D4 and HC1 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019).

| Prior to occupation of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the sound insulation value of the floors/ceilings separating dwellings from the dance studio and commercial/communal uses. Details of mitigation measures shall demonstrate that dance floors, exercise equipment and loudspeakers are vibration isolated and that music, instructor's voices, exercise classes, activities and use of equipment will not cause structural or airborne transmission of noise or vibration in excess of an acoustic standard within the dwellings of
- NR25 Lmax(fast) from structure borne/ impact noise
- NR20 Leq,5min from general airborne activity noise (including music)
when noise is generated at maximum capacity within the dance studio. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of future residential occupiers, in accordance with policies 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The sound insulation of the residential building envelope including glazing specifications and external amenity areas shall achieve

compliance with the acoustic noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. If compliance requires the windows to be closed, then acoustically attenuated mechanical ventilation and cooling shall be installed as necessary (with air intake from the cleanest aspect of the building and low self-noise). The above shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2019). | The external rating noise level emitted from plant/machinery/equipment/ducting/air in-and outlets/mechanical installations, together with mitigation measures, as appropriate, shall have an external rating noise level LAeq emitted that is lower than the lowest existing background sound level LA90 by 10dBA at the most noise sensitive receiver locations at the development site and at surrounding premises. This shall be in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all plant/equipment operating together at maximum capacity. Prior to occupation of the development, post installation verification report for sound assessment shall be submitted to and approved in writing to confirm compliance with the noise criteria, with additional steps to mitigate noise shall be taken, as necessary. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2019) | The proposed lightwell shall be made accessible for the occupant of the studio unit hereby approved.

Reason: In the interests of providing outdoor amenity space and good design in accordance with policy 7D.2 of Ealing's Development Management DPD(2013) and policy D6 of the London Pan(2021) | At least five (5) secure cycle parking spaces shall be provided on site and retained thereafter
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with London Plan (2021) policy T5 and table 10.2

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage  as shown on the approved plans are made available for use in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Part change of use of  basement from dance studio (Use Class D1) to residential (Use Class C3) to accommodate 1 x studio flat.

superseding_details.component_description: Dance Studio D1 to Residential C3
